sentences.sContent: He was very skilled at pointing down the blocks of granite.
sentences.sContent_eng: He was very skilled at pointing down the blocks of granite.
sentences.sCn: 他善于把花岗岩石凿平。

sentences.sContent: If you're working in steel or granite, redesigning or adding onto something is very expensive.
sentences.sContent_eng: If you're working in steel or granite, redesigning or adding onto something is very expensive.
sentences.sCn: 如果你用钢或花岗岩来工作，重新设计或增加一些东西是很贵的。

sentences.sContent: Everything you see, from the cobblestones the characters walk on to the granite within the buildings, all those details help to bring you into that era.
sentences.sContent_eng: Everything you see, from the cobblestones the characters walk on to the granite within the buildings, all those details help to bring you into that era.
sentences.sCn: 影片里你所见之处，从角色走过的鹅卵石路到大楼的花岗石，所有的细节都能帮助将你置身于那个年代。” 克罗尔解释道。

remMethod.val: gran(=grain颗粒) + ite → 颗粒状石头 → 花岗岩

words.tran: 花岗石的；由花岗岩形成的

trans.tranOther: a very hard grey rock, often used in building
